e4: The current policy, while seemingly benefiting investors by managing expectations, is ethically questionable.  The new policy promotes transparency and long-term trust, although there will be short-term market adjustments.  The ethical implications of the current policy and the potential for unfair advantage to sophisticated investors make switching to the new policy the right decision in the long run.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency and accuracy.  It presents information fairly, without bias or manipulation, aiming to provide a complete and understandable picture of the company's performance.  It avoids misleading practices, even if they are technically legal, and considers the potential impact on all stakeholders, including investors of varying sophistication.  Consistent application of accounting standards is crucial.
e6: I would ask about the specific methods used to bias earnings under the previous policy and a detailed plan for communicating the policy change to investors. I would also want to understand how the company plans to mitigate the potential for short-term negative market reaction and ensure fair treatment of all investors during this transition.
